definition: To suddenly escape or break free from a confined space or situation, often associated with a sense of urgency or force. This word is commonly used to describe actions of animals, prisoners, or individuals trying to flee from captivity or confinement.

examples.german: Er ist aus dem Gef√§ngnis ausgebrochen.
Der Hund ist aus dem Garten ausgebrochen.
examples.english: The dog has broken out of the garden.

examples.german: Die Gewalt ist in der Stadt ausgebrochen.
examples.english: Violence has erupted in the city.
